intro: Caraguata devansayana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
